content.question: Which of the following gives the best estimate for the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a <math alttext="5 times 10 to the negative 4 power molar S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Sr</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 3.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>3.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Sr(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong acid.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 5.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Sr(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a weak acid.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 9.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>9.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Sr(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a weak base.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 11.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>11.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Sr(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong base.

content.answer: <math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 11.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>11.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="S r, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Sr(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong base.

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
